text:
The "Pittsburgh Post-Gazette", also known simply as the PG, is the largest newspaper serving metropolitan Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, United States. It has won six Pulitzer Prizes since 1938. Around 170,630 papers are printed and delivered daily.
The Pittsburgh "Post" first appeared on September 10, 1842, as the "Daily Morning Post". It had its origin in three pro-Democratic weeklies, the "Mercury", "Allegheny Democrat", and "American Manufacturer".
